text: Allan J Robinson (born 1935-2010), was a male weightlifter who competed for England. ==Weightlifting career== He represented Great Britain at the 1960 Summer Olympics finishing in 18th place in the featherweight category. He represented England and finished fifth in the -60 Kg combined category at the 1958 British Empire and Commonwealth Games in Cardiff, Wales. He was a body builder and won the 1955 Mr. Great Britain competition, he ran a gym in the Lancashire town of Blackburn with Darwen and was a plumber by trade. ==References== Category:1935 births Category:2010 deaths Category:English male weightlifters Category:Weightlifters at the 1958 British Empire and Commonwealth Games Category:Olympic weightlifters of Great Britain Category:Weightlifters at the 1960 Summer Olympics
title: Allan Robinson
